headline: Pete Buttigieg continues religious crusade against Mike Pence
subHeadline: Guests: Frank Luntz, Mark Levine, Robert Ortt, Kristan Hawkins

utterances.speaker: LAURA INGRAHAM, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hey, everybody. I'm Laura Ingraham this is “The Ingraham Angle” tonight from Washington. Now last night, we explained why Obama Intel czar Jim Clapper was so testy, gosh he was angry about Attorney General Bill Barr confirming that the Trump campaign had indeed been spied upon. Now he wasn't the only one. And tonight, is Jim Comey's turn in the barrel. Plus, the Democrats congressional hearings this week or a farce from beginning to end. All the embarrassing moments you know you miss them and the hilarious clap backs. All coming up. And Raymond Arroyo is here. So, what's behind Mayor Pete's religious war against Vice President Pence. Don't get it. And screwing Louis Farrakhan forgot what funeral he was attending. All that more in a special holy edition of Friday Follies.  But first in our “Ingraham Angle,” we can review some stories you may have missed. Now, first we hit immigration. Now the left has a very interesting way of approaching this issue. It's not an emergency, is it? When 100,000 people are pouring across our southern border. But when it's reported that President Trump is considering busing illegal immigrant detainees to sanctuary cities. Well, the Democrats totally freak out. The President up the ante today.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: We can give him a lot. We can give them an unlimited supply and let's see if they're so happy. They say we have open arms. They're always say they have open arms. Let's see if they have open arms.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, now the President may have legal standing to make good on this threat and look at how the Democrats are squirming now. Nancy Pelosi said, the extent of this administration's cynicism and cruelty cannot be overstated. But wait a second, shouldn't she and her other California politicians, the ones are all for open borders. Shouldn't they be thrilled. They are the ones after all who have said this about sanctuary cities.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, SPEAKER, HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
utterances.sentences: In our sanctuary cities, our people are not disobeying the law. So, it's not a question of giving sanctuary someone who has - is guilty of a crime. UNIDENTIFIED MALE: The fact is sanctuary cities keep people safer. They keep people healthier and they keep people educated.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Gosh, I mean that's just a commercial for sanctuary cities. Take them in, bring them in, welcome them in. But it's not so simple, is it? Consider this horrific crime in the sanctuary city of Jersey City. An illegal alien is charged in the March 24th rape and murder of jogger Carolina Cano. Jorge Rios had been deported two times from the United States before returning illegally a third time. Now Cano worked as a nanny and friends say, she was an incredible woman of strong faith and a beautiful giving heart. But the left doesn't even acknowledge these American tragedies. They're too busy trying to demonize Trump on this and score political points, which brings us to our next story. This week, Democrats continued flailing in the wake of Bob Mueller's no collusion finding. Now I think they're beyond desperate at this point to regain political footing after two years of leveling defamatory and false accusations against the President. Remember he was basically spooning with Vladimir Putin before the election. But they've quickly found a new target, Attorney General Bill Barr.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: His credibility will be absolutely shredded if he fails to retract this assertion.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He lost whatever credibility he may have had.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The Chief Law Enforcement officer of our country is going off the rails.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The Attorney General feels that it's his job to do the President's bidding.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Now watching Barr at the hearings this week flick off all of their insipid comments and inquiries one-by-one. I've got to say I watch every minute of all these hearings and with Barr, it was better than anything on Netflix. The media though of course joined the Liberals bar crawl looking for any buzz they could get.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This guy is on a tight rope. On one side he wants to lean one way to make sure Trump keeps him in the job and the other way, don't look like an ass.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You can almost see in his mind, Barr going OK. How do I answer this question so, Trump doesn't tweet at me? So, I keep my job. But still not make a jackass of myself for life.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: That's tough.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: You know what's tough? This obvious thought. Afraid to lose his job. You mean go back to a comfortable no stress retirement and enjoy his grandkids. Are you kidding me? Why would Bill Barr do something unethical today in order to save a job he already had 30 years ago. News flash, he doesn't need to build his resume, kids. At the moment that sent shivers down the spines of the former Obama deep stators was this one.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I think spying on a political campaign is a big deal. Yes, I think spying did occur and I'm not suggesting it wasn't adequately predicated. But I need to explore that.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, I wondered how former FBI Chief Jim Comey felt upon hearing that spying reference.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Look this was terrible. It makes me mildly nauseous to think that we might have had some impact on the election.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, it turns out that former spooks was something to hide, practice the art of deflection and then they play word games.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Spying has a term I've never liked. I never liked that term being applied to me. It has a bad connotation. It's a pejorative term.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I really don't know what he's talking about when he talks about spying on the campaign. The FBI and the Department of Justice conduct court ordered electronic surveillance. I have never thought of that as spying.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So, let me get this straight. Clapper and Comey otherwise known as Jim Squared. That's what we call here, were the guys determined to get something on President Trump both through surveillance and leaking to the media. But now they're spending their time quibbling with the term spying. Now this concern which is all phony over semantics. Of course, it's reeks of desperation. I think the real fear is that Attorney General Barr is extremely serious. He's very judicious, extremely professional and he's on the case. And they also know that the Inspector General Mike Horowitz will not only clean up this mess but hold those who perpetrated this fraud accountable. Here now, Sara Carter and Former Deputy Independent Counsel Sol Wisenberg, both are Fox News contributors. Sol, why do you think now they're worried about surveillance versus spying. When Bill Barr himself said numerous times, I'm not saying it was necessarily impermissible. I'm just saying that's what I'm saying.

utterances.speaker: SOL WISENBERG, FORMER DEPUTY INDEPENDENT COUNSEL
utterances.sentences: He's saying it's a big deal if the government is spying on a major political party candidate was it well predicated. We don't know. I'd be silly not to look at it. Really, I think that's the really dangerous thing that they see in Barr. He's making a very simple observation that nobody in the media and almost nobody in the Democratic Party has made for the last two years. That's a big deal. And you better have a really good reason before you spy on any major candidate of any party.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I mean we keep saying this Sara, you've said it. Imagine if the shoe were on the other foot. Imagine if George W. Bush's DOJ had authorized surveillance of Obama's campaign team. Can you imagine what the ACLU and all these organizations would have - they would have been screaming holy hell about it.

utterances.speaker: SARA CARTER, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Well, most of the civil libertarians would have been going crazy.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: And the New York Times and The Washington Post would have won Pulitzers because they would have put all their money into investigating why the Bush campaign was spying. But all we need to do is look at right now Laura. There is good reason for William Barr, for the Attorney General to say these things. He obviously has more information than we do. We've been reporting on this John Solomon and I starting back over two and a half years ago with the expansion of authorities under the Obama administration that allowed people within the intelligence community to spy at an enormous rate. Now some of that was legalized because they expanded it. But he's going to take a hard look at a political campaign that was given no defensive briefing that was approached by a ...

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: He said they were. He said I heard him today on another network Clapper saying, they were given defensive briefings and they were told about Russian possible meddling. He said that on another networks.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: That's absolutely not true.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: He said it.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: He gave them ...

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Christie said, they didn't do it, I believe on my podcast.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. He did not. What they gave him was a generalized briefing that the Russians, the Chinese.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: That's what Christie told me.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Ukrainians. Yes. But they never gave them a defensive briefing detailing that George Papadopoulos or Carter Page were ever ...

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: But if you really worried all about, the Russians flipping the election results. I mean someone like Christie, these guys have been blind prosecutors, you would have told them, and he told me in my podcast, they didn't tell you about Russian meddling.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: Here' is the key thing which is Lisa Page testified her testimony has been released now to Congress. Somebody asked her that question and she said, we didn't think there was enough evidence even to give a defensive briefing and yet they thought it was good enough to go to the FISA court.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Oh! My God.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: So, I mean that's real. And here's what's sad.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Oh! My God.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: Here's what's sad. I think in the Watergate era that would have been investigated and covered whatever party did it. And it just hasn't been covered. They've acted like it's not real.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And they ridiculed Trump for saying they were wiretapping Trump Tower and other phraseology whether it was wiretap or surveil whatever. But they were being surveilled and they laughed at him. They ridiculed him non- stop.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: They're not ridiculing Barr; I think they're worried about Barr and I think Barr is the real deal. He's going to restore integrity ...

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: We need it.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: Integrity to the Department.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And I want to play Swalwell, Eric Swalwell. Maybe you missed it. But he's running for president now. He announced it on a late-night comedy show.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: Of his high school class.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Exactly. Town Council. And he said this about Barr. Both of you. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: REP. ERIC SWALWELL, D-CALIF., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: The Attorney General should recuse himself immediately. He has no business touching any part of this investigation. He also is doing the exact opposite of what Jeff Sessions did. Jeff Sessions was recused. Attorney General Barr is completely embedded. So, he should recuse Sara quickly.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Oh! Absolutely not. I mean look Eric Swalwell is just grasping at straws trying to find something to say, it's complete hyperbole. It's ridiculous. And I don't think Barr is at all threatened by ...

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I also want to get your thoughts on Greg Craig, Former White House Counsel under Obama. He was indicted. He was a partner in my old law firm Skadden Arps for hiding information related to foreign lobbying work for Ukraine. Ukraine has been in the news a lot. They stem from what they found out various issues Sol in the Mueller investigation. But the MSNBC Justice and Security Analyst Matt Miller has some questions.

utterances.speaker: MATT MILLER, MSNBC JUSTICE AND SECURITY ANALYST
utterances.sentences: I don't know whether the charges against Greg Craig are justified or not. There's something fishy about the way the Justice Department brought this case that they still have yet to explain why they brought this case after one office declined to bring it. They haven't yet to give it. And I think without that it does raise questions over whether the prosecution is political or not.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It's OK to go after Manafort, but not OK to go after Greg Craig.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: I have no question about whether or not it's political. But I don't know how righteous it is. I haven't read the charges and remember, they only prosecuted 10 people over a 50-year period. So, I would want to look. They certainly weren't sending a signal that they thought this was something they were enforcing. I wouldn't want to look ...

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: There are a lot of people who do consulting for foreign governments. A lot of people.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: Right. And you know Craig and I are not bosom buddies, but still indictment is a serious thing I would want to take a look at it.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK. Really quick. We're almost out of time, but Judge Carlton Reeves U.S. district court judge yesterday said this. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: CARLTON REEVES, DISTRICT COURT JUDGE
utterances.sentences: When politicians attack the courts is dangerous, political and guilty of egregious overreach. You can hear the claims lawyers assailing officers of the court across the south when the executive branch calls out courts and they'll work stupid, horrible, ridiculous, incompetent, a laughingstock and a complete and total disgrace. You can hear the slurs and threats of executives like George Wallace echoing into the present.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Sara, Obama appointee Code of Conduct for U.S. judges not supposed to be involved in politics. There is a slight exception for it. If the judiciary is being persecuted, I guess that's what he would be hanging on.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Yes, correct. But I mean think about this. Think about how these enormous attacks on President Trump and then coming from a judge, right. We're just crossing every line. I mean I don't know how you feel about this. But to me it just crosses the line. It shows what's been happening in the United States. And I personally think that there is something that needs to be done about ...

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Can't get into politics as a judge, can't do it.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: Well, I haven't seen the whole context of it, and I don't - of the President's criticisms of the judiciary, so I'd like to hear the whole thing.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So, the executive branch when it's stymied time after again by one or two federal district court judges can't have a comment on it. Federal policy, you can comment on it.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: You can comment. But don't say ...

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: He's an elected official though Sol, the judges. He's an officer of the court.

utterances.speaker: WISENBERG
utterances.sentences: He can comment. I don't like the comments he's made.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: But a lot of judges now have been creating policy, not just judging.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It's not an imperial judiciary either. I don't like these judges getting into politics, but you know we'll be respectful of the courts I think that's a fair point. All right. My next guest says the Democrats obsession and thank you two. I don't even say, thank you. How rude on a Friday night. Session over investigating Trump and his administration will actually hurt them. He says it reminds me of 2002 and 2010 elections that saw Democrats obsessing over what, Enron. Remember the financial crisis media guru pollster Frank Luntz is next.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Kind of sell a deal and it's your top priority. Come on, Mr. Sparks. Should Goldman Sachs.be trying to sell the deal. Can you answer that one, yes or no?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The chairman of Enron, Kenneth Lay and his wife contributed close to $800,000 to the Republican Party since 1988. During the 2000 presidential campaign, Enron made available its fleet of corporate jets for political travel by President Bush.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Now media guru pollster Frank Luntz joins us now. Frank both of your examples where midterms you know this voter weariness over these investigations during a Presidential election. Could the same dynamic be at play?

utterances.speaker: FRANK LUNTZ, AMERICAN CONSULTANT
utterances.sentences: I think it may be. Look voters want people in Washington to be their voice and they want the people in Washington to hold businesses accountable if they do something illegal, they do something wrong. And they appreciated early in those election cycles the Democrats for holding Enron accountable and for holding the banks and the real estate companies and all those involved in the meltdown of 2008, 2009. But what happens is if you go too far. If you look like you're trying to score political points if you're trying to get yourself elected off the backs of the pain that the American people feel not only don't, they like that but they end up punishing the party who seems to be doing it. In 2002, the Democrats had a six-point generic ballot lead with eight weeks to go and they lost it. In 2010, they had a seven-point lead with 90 days to go and they lost that one as well. In the end voters will punish politicians who seem to be scoring political points when people are suffering.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well and I think now people are doing better. You know that's pretty by all accounts it's a pretty good time if you're if you want to work you probably be able to get a job, probably have a little bit more money in your pocket. People are pretty optimistic about the economy. And it's interesting Frank because The Washington Post ABC did a poll. Here's the poll question, do you think Democrats will go too far investigating Trump or not far enough go too far, 46, percent not go far enough, 17 percent.

utterances.speaker: LUNTZ
utterances.sentences: It's happening then that's should be the wakeup call. They left town to do their retreat. And it's interesting because today is the 100th day of the Democratic Congress. Can you name one accomplishment in the first 100 days. Go back to 1994, the Republicans passed 10 solid pieces of legislation. They never went home. They did their job. Democrats are now on a two-week recess, a two-week vacation. They go to a resort area and they talk about all the things that they haven't done. And that polling data is obvious but there is also a warning for the Republicans which is not to become complacent and to remember that in the end they were elected to be the voice of the people. And they have that responsibility in what they do.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes, Frank I thought the image yesterday we pointed out in “The Angle” of Trump with the hardhats in Texas. The oil workers and the ranchers and then the Democrats with John Legend and Chrissy Teigen who are trashing in the most disgusting way the President. And it was like hanging out with the elites, doing yoga sessions in the afternoon and then Trump with the blue-collar workers. I thought it was a great - I thought that study in contrast I think was pretty powerful.

utterances.speaker: LUNTZ
utterances.sentences: Well, you raise an important point which is that the visual is as important as what is said. And if the Democrats think that hanging out at expensive resorts and laughing about what's going on in Washington is going to get them elected, they're wrong. The American people still expect Washington to do its job. Expect them to work hard. To get results that that they can measure. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right, Frank. Frank, thanks so much. Frank Luntz here on “The Ingraham Angle.” And up next. Democrats were Mad Maxine Waters and Jerry Nadler spent the better part of the week embarrassing themselves during committee hearings. I know you didn't see them. Don't worry. We watched for you. The segment called Hearing Slade. Stay there.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right with committee hearings all week, it was like from beginning to end. Yes. We took the time to highlight some of the Democrats, sorry most pathetic attempts at trapping conservatives and we have a new segment, we're calling it, Hearing Slade. Get it. And here with me to help break it all down Matt Schlapp, Chairman of the American Conservative Union. He says it's a bad pun. And Virginia State Rep. Mark Levine. It's great to have you on, both of you. Now let's start with Mad Maxine. OK. This is just two of the most embarrassing exchanges she had. And I'm just talking in the last week.

utterances.speaker: STEVEN MNUCHIN, SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY
utterances.sentences: There's never been anybody that's been here more than three hours and 15 minutes. I've sat here for over three hour and 15 minutes.

utterances.speaker: REP. MAXINE WATERS, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: I appreciate your reminding us of the length of time, other secretaries have been here. This is a new way and it's a new day. And it's a new chair. And I have the gavel at this point. If you wish to leave, you may.

utterances.speaker: MNUCHIN
utterances.sentences: Can you clarify that for me.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: If you wish to leave, you may. What are you guys doing to help us with this student loan debt? Who would like to answer first?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We'd stop making student loans in 2007 or so.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Oh! So, you don't do it anymore. Mr. Corbett (ph).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We exited student lending in 2009.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Mr. Diamond (ph).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: When the government took over student lending in 2010 or so we stopped doing all student lending.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, Matt, do you think the Head of the Financial Services Committee might have had a handle on when the government actually took over the business of student loans and Mnuchin just wanted to get to a meeting with like was it the President of Oman.

utterances.speaker: MATT SCHLAPP, AMERICAN CONSERVATIVE UNION CHAIR
utterances.sentences: Bahrain.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Bahrain was waiting and waiting. OK.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: I have never seen a Secretary of the Treasury be put in time out before. He has to raise his hand if he wants to go the bathroom. It was completely absurd.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And it was using the gavel and saying look this is my - when you actually have to say I have the gavel. Isn't that kind of all ...

utterances.speaker: MARK LEVINE, VIRGINIA STATE REPRESENTATIVE
utterances.sentences: What he says I don't know if I can leave or stay. She said you're free to go. And he's like I don't know what you mean, you're free to go. He didn't understand English there.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: What he was getting at was she wouldn't dismiss the hearing.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Formal end of the hearing is hit the gavel what he called the gravel.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: That's right. He did.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It got so - we didn't mean to edit that out sorry, but he's called it gravel. Because he was just like come on. I think they had a gentleman agreement ...

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: They can continue - they do after he goes.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: No, that's not - you know you're a legislator.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: Of course, they can.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: You just end that panel and you can bring it in.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: But what she was saying is she wanted to own the idea that he looked like he walked away. LEVINE: He wants to walk out obviously.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: We were accomplishing so much with the hearing, asking dumb questions about things that happened 10 years ago.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: Asking questions like whether he should disclose Donald Trump's tax returns.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think ....

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: Given that the law requires him to do that. You said it doesn't. You know what I've brought the law with me.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: No props. If she can't remember the statute.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: No, I know the statutes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK. Well, guess what, if you think Americans are going to vote on Donald Trump's tax reform, I want you to go to his ...

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: But I think we're going to vote on law whether they obey the law or not. And Republicans wants to agree with law abiding.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Maxine Waters embarrassing in that clip about the student lending. I mean if you're a junior associate at your law firm did that, you'd be like wait a second. Where did you go to law school?

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: But if you're a junior associate at a law firm said, we don't have to follow the tax code.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: I'm with Bill Barr on this one.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: Mnuchin could go to jail for six years. That's actually much more closer.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, I have a feeling Mnuchin is not going to go to jail for six years, but Mad Maxine wasn't the only one with no idea about what falls under the purview of the particular person they were questioning. Now here's Rep. Matt Cartwright hitting a Bill Barr roadblock. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Your decision does for its breadth, its scope, its recklessness and its lack of legal justification to invalidate the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We tried to base our answer on the law. If you think it's such an outrageous position you have nothing to worry about. Let the courts do their job.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm dismayed to hear that you're willing to drive our health care system off the cliff with no plan for replacing it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I think that your premise that the Justice Department makes health care policy is simply wrong. We take legal positions and cases.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Now Mark you have to admit, this is strange. He didn't have Alex Azar, HHS Secretary up there. He didn't have the White House Chief of Staff up there. Maybe in the lobby. He had the Attorney General of the United States. Well, you're going to push grandma off the cliff. He's like what. I took a position that the administration agrees on that they want to take.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: The question is whether they're going to enforce the law.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: He's not the HSS Secretary.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: No, but he's the Attorney General.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: But it's a composition that the administration itself jointly comes to.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: Right. But the Supreme Court was very clear. You may not like it. The Affordable Care Act is constitutional. And he's got to obey it. All of this is about lawless.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: No, it's not.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: This is about whether Republicans under Trump.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: Jump real fast what this is about is the idea that Obamacare does not stand because the Congress legally pulled out the individual mandate. That's what the question.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: No one can follow this conversation. It's too confusing. But he doesn't run health care policy. That's the point that I want to - and I think he said that.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Not to say they can't ask questions. All right. This was Congressman Mazie Hirono's other half in Hawaii. What's his name Brian Schatz. I always forget his name because Senator Schatz. All right. This is a Q&A that we also watched. Check it out.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I think the word spying could cause everybody in the cable news ecosystem to freak out and I think it's necessary for you to be precise with your language here you normally are. And I want to give you a chance to be especially precise here.

utterances.speaker: BRIAN SCHATZ, SENATOR
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure of all the connotations of that word that you're referring to, but unauthorized surveillance. I want to make sure there was no unauthorized surveillance.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: SCHATZ
utterances.sentences: Is that more appropriate in your mind?

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Is it OK to say unauthorized surveillance.

utterances.speaker: LEVINE
utterances.sentences: It was authorized surveillance.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Is it OK to say unauthorized surveillance.

utterances.speaker: SCHLAPP
utterances.sentences: And spying is OK too.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right. All right, panel, thank you so much. A holy or unholy Friday Follies next with Raymond Arroyo.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It's Friday, and that means it's time for a holy, or is it an unholy edition of Friday Follies? Mayor Pete takes a swipe at Vice President Pence Mike Pence, the Pope bows, and Louis Farrakhan ruins a rapper's funeral? Joining us now with all the details is Raymond Arroyo, Fox News contributor, "New York Times" bestselling author of the brand new book, "Will Wilder, The Amulet of Power." All right, Raymond, Pete Buttigieg making a lot of headlines, raising a lot of money. I think he's basically number two now in Iowa. He's a force to be reckoned with. He's really, like, poking at the vice president. What's going on with that?

utterances.speaker: RAYMOND ARROYO, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Well, this is part of a deliberate strategy, Laura, and probably an unwise one. For the last few weeks the Democratic golden boy has been engaged in a faith feud with V.P. Mike Pence. Buttigieg has repeatedly questioned the vice president's faith. Yesterday in an interview with CNN Pence responded.

utterances.speaker: MIKE PENCE, VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: I hope that will Pete will offer more to the American people than attacks on my Christian faith or attacks on the president.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: He argues that your quarrel is with him as a gay man and that he says I was born this way.

utterances.speaker: PENCE
utterances.sentences: I think Pete's quarrel is with the First Amendment. All of us in this country have the right to our religious beliefs.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: Basically the vice president is saying people have a diversity of beliefs, and stop questioning my faith since I've not questioned yours. But Buttigieg won't let go, Laura. He hit the Vice President Pence again on "Ellen" today.

utterances.speaker: PETE BUTTIGIEG, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: I'm not critical of his faith. I'm critical of bad policies. I don't have a problem with religion. I'm religious too. I have a problem with religion being used as a justification to harm people, and especially in the LGBTQ community.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: That is not entirely true. When Mayor Pete started this religious crusade against Pence, it was not focused on LGBT issue, but it was a kind of ideologically infused puritanism. He challenged Mike Pence's character. Remember this?

utterances.speaker: PETE BUTTIGIEG, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: His interpretation of scripture is pretty different from mine to begin with. It is about protecting the stranger and the prisoner and the poor person. How could he allow himself to become the cheerleader of the porn star presidency?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: Then later he would go on to call the Mike Pences of the world to account for their unwillingness to accept him. But this is not about rights, Laura. This is about a small town mayor trying to break from the pack, distinguish himself from the crowd, and I think a vain attempt to reclaim religion for a party that has let it languish and disparage it for too many years.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I would say, as a political analyst, if I were consulting with Buttigieg, I would say definitely make yourself stand out. It's a big crowd. I'm not sure the social issues is going to work for the Democrats. When the social issues come to the fore, when they're brought to the fore, they usually end up helping Republicans, I think. I think it's a little, Mike Pence is about the most innocuous, nicest person.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: Likeable guy.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Is he out there talking about LGBT issues?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: It puts Buttigieg in the position of being a judgmental, rather puritan, virtue signaling guy who is judging someone else for his faith --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Tell me what you think about this.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: -- unless you do what I do. And you just mentioned the social issues, Laura. In South Bend, he has got a problem. There was with a crisis pregnancy center that wanted to open up near an abortion clinic, he shut it down, Buttigieg did.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: What about those religious guides. I guess that is OK in the Episcopalian faith, I guess.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: This is the tension. This is the tension between religious liberty and other rights that are making a claim here.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: The question is should people be able to have their religious beliefs? Is he going to go through the list of Muslims, of orthodox Jews, of others who have a certain set of beliefs that might not be copasetic with what Ellen and he believes?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: When he announces on Palm Sunday. OK, we've got to talk about Pope Francis for a moment. Yesterday at the Vatican the 82-year-old Pope hosted a group of South Sudanese leaders who have been locked in a civil war since 2011. To drive home his plea for peace in a surprise move, the Pope got down on his hands and knees, Laura, to kiss the feet of four South Sudanese leaders. You can hear him heaving really heavily here. Remember, the Pope only has one functioning lung. Some have praised the humility of this gesture, it's power. Others have questioned it. They say it's an act of submission to political leaders and it could be interpreted by some, particularly Muslims on the ground in Sudan as an act of submission. I'm not sure I'm buying that interpretation. It is a rather dramatic gesture.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, it's supposed to be he's showing that he's, Christ came to be a servant.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: And humble.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Humility, he's in servitude to man.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I have got to say, does it become showy? He seemed to not like anyone kissing his ring, remember that?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: He did the ring kissing deal.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: Now he's kissing feet. But Laura, 400,000 dead in South Sudan, so it's a big challenge.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So maybe that will inspire people to get along, maybe. Yesterday in L.A. thousands lined the streets to say goodbye to rapper Nipsey Hussle. This dear artist recently released a song called "FDT," F Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: -- Donald Trump, yes -- Donald Trump. Yes, yes -- Donald Trump. -- Donald Trump. -- Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: That's a very creative refrain.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: Very catchy. Irving Berlin, look out.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It all began and ended with Irving Berlin for you, didn't it?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So the refrain, the chorus that goes on and on, is that related to the lowest unemployment ever, basically, for African-Americans?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: But at Hussle's funeral, Laura, the less than holy religious figure Louis Farrakhan rose to offer a reflection.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: This is nice.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: It's always a good idea before you give a eulogy to know the name of the deceased. That helps. Which in this case was Nipsey Hussle.

utterances.speaker: LOUIS FARRAKHAN
utterances.sentences: The spiritual life of Nipsey Russell. I thank Nipsey Russell. I said it right.

utterances.speaker: FARRAKHAN
utterances.sentences: Russell.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: For those who might not remember, there was a '70s comedian, Nipsey Russell.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I love him.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Young people are very different today. And there's one sure way to know. Kids used to ask where they came from. Now they'll tell you where you can go.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Oh my God, was that "Match Game"?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: It was "Match Game."

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: My grandmother loved that.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: Brett Somers come on down.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Wasn't he on "Hollywood Squares," and on "The Love Boat"?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.sentences: I have to say, after that, I love Nipsey Russell. Nipsey Hussle, may he rest in peace.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: God bless. Up next, after passing a bill that essentially legalizes infanticide, what would you think the New York Assembly, you couldn't sink any lower if you were they. Now they're giving benefits to illegals that veterans' families are denied. I cannot believe this, you won't either, next.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Just how destructive can one state assembly be? In New York just over two months after celebrating their abortion expansion law, otherwise known as yay infanticide, New York Democrats just voted to block a provision that would extend additional college financial aid for Gold Star families. And if it wasn't disgusting enough, this vote came right after the same body approved millions in tuition assistance for, you got it, illegal aliens. Joining me is New York Republican State Senator Robert Ortt. Senator, what's your message to the country after what your colleagues on the left did? It's an insult to American veterans and American military families nationwide.

utterances.speaker: ROBERT ORTT, R-N.Y., STATE SENATOR
utterances.sentences: I think the message is New York should act as a warning to the rest of the country of what will happen if the Democrats take over all levels of power of the federal government in 2020, because they own everything here in New York, the Senate, the Assembly, and of course the governor's office. And this is what you get. You get priorities, I would say show me your budget, I'll show you your priorities -- $27 million, as you mentioned, for so the-called Dream Act to provide tuition assistance to illegal aliens, people who are here who have broken our immigration laws. And at the same time, they killed this bill which would have expanded access to the families, to the children of fallen servicemembers. If that isn't an inversion of what is right and good, I don't know what is. So it really is a message to I think the people who are watching out there that this is what the Democrats, the regressives will do if they get control of the U.S. government.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Both coasts were represented in this just obscene, radical thinking. California, if it moves tax it. Pushing the pot deal, the pot legal, all of the stuff in New York is basically becoming a mirror image. And this is what -- this is where we're going. It's open borders, rewarding lawlessness, and penalizing the hardworking people, families who don't make a lot of money, whose father or mother paid the ultimate price for our freedom. They don't care. I got to show something. This is from a New York congresswoman trying to defend all this, Deborah Glick. She's the chair of the committee that blocked the bill. She calls criticism of her basically a cheap shot. "The bill -- though laudable -- had a budgetary impact which the committee routinely doesn't consider post budget. We did promise to see funding in the future that considers potential additional eligible individuals. Cheap shot." Is it a cheap shot, they're going to take this under advisement later on? So why are you making a big deal?

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.sentences: This isn't a cheap shot at all. I think it's really rich that Congresswoman Glick and other Democrats, suddenly they're fiscal conservatives, suddenly they're concerned about the taxpayer and additional dollars spent. They just increased taxes by over $1 billion in the budget that was adopted April 1st. We were one of the highest tax states in the country. And they gave away $27 million tax dollars to folks who have broken our immigration laws and who are here in this state illegally. And yet when it comes to people who have given the ultimate sacrifices --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I don't know. It's too much money, costs too much.

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.sentences: -- and their families who bear the price, this is too much money. We need to hold the line and be fiscally conservative. That's really rich.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: The costs of freedom. Freedom costs something, doesn't it? This is what NBC 2 Buffalo pointed out, "providing free tuition for Gold Star children would not cost nearly as much as providing the same for tens of thousands of eligible Dreamers who will now be provided financial assistance to attend college by the state."

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So, it's a drop in the bucket compared to the cost would be for college assistance? Again, what's up is down, what's right is left. Everything has gone completely off the rails crazy if this is what New York stands for. I remember, I love New York, I used to wear one of those t- shirts. Not so much after infanticide and this. Close it out, senator.

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.sentences: No, you're 100 percent right, Laura. This really is a complete inversion, it's like Bizarro World, what is right is left, what is up is down. And basically you said it. If you are a hardworking, taxpaying New Yorker, if you served in the military, if you're in law enforcement, you are not a priority. If you're a criminal --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Why are you voting for this? New York, why are you voting for this? Why is this helping your state or doing anything to advance common sense principles of fiscal responsibility and fairness? Senator, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Laura.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And by the way, speaking of radicalism, a pro-choice college student, I like to say proabortion rights activist, says babies who survive abortion shouldn't get healthcare. But who does she actually say does deserve it? We'll tell you, next.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, you have been watching this show, you know that college campuses are worse than ever when it comes to free expression and real tolerance, especially the tolerance for views that are right to life. Well, take this exchange between a student at Boston College and Kristan Hawkins, president of students for life.

utterances.speaker: KRISTAN HAWKINS, STUDENTS FOR LIFE OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: Do you think that the children that are apprehended at the border that are in U.S. government care, do you think, like, babies who are going to die should be resuscitated and be given care?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.sentences: Do you believe that, like, a baby who's born alive during abortion at a Planned Parenthood should get care?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Joining me now is Kristan Hawkins. Kristan, you travel the country visiting college campuses, talking to students. You really kind of pointed out the -- illogical thinking is one thing. It's sad, it's funny in a way, but it's very sad. What happened next after that exchange?

utterances.speaker: KRISTAN HAWKINS, STUDENTS FOR LIFE OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: I actually asked her why she didn't believe that babies who are born alive during a failed abortion should be allowed to live. She said, well, we've already determined it's not a baby. And then she went on to say, I know you said science, but. And so what she pointed out was the cognitive dissonance we see all the time on college campuses across the country. And I don't know whether or not I changed her mind, but I know she certainly changed the minds of a lot of pro-choice students who actually came to the event to protest me. I got to see their eyes light up when she pointed out the leftist hypocrisy on this issue.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So again, for people who missed it, you asked about children at the border, should they be helped, should they be cared for, infants, yes. A baby who is born despite an attempt to abort the baby, no. But it's reflexive, is it not? It's not like there's some deep moment of reflection. It's reflexive.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.sentences: That's right. This is exactly, they're just repeating the talking points that they hear. And when it comes out of their mouth and you force the other side to actually say what it is they're advocating for, it changes the minds of everyone who is listening because they realize, this doesn't make sense. This is illogical. Your humanity shouldn't be determined by the location of your delivery room.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Isn't this what happened, you were at UCLA's campus about a year ago. Tell us about that.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I've been to UCLA, Berkeley, Harvard, Princeton, all of these schools, Dartmouth.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Good for you.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.sentences: And we have this conversation. My tour is called "The Lies that Feminists Tell." I just tell women, you are being lied to by the abortion lobby that tells you, you have to pay somebody else to commit an act of violence against somebody weaker than you in order for you to live your life as you see fit. And that's wrong. That's actually anti-feminist.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And what is the reaction from, is there -- you're brave to be doing this. You're a brave person. I just want to salute you for doing this, because I think a lot of young women, I say this on the radio show, when you're in your 20s, especially when I was in my 20s, it wasn't an issue. But now, with the help of science, digital science techniques, you can see inside the womb, now it's a person. We were all -- speaking as a former embryo, we all were.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.sentences: That's right. And millennials, the good news is, Laura, the majority of our generation are actually pro-life. We're the largest voting bloc now in America, and we reject those lies that the abortion industry tells us.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Are you seeing "Unplanned"? Did you see "Unplanned"?

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.sentences: Absolutely, we sent thousands of students to see "Unplanned." We actually had a baby saved today in Indiana after students when and saw "Unplanned," went and prayed in front of Planned Parenthood and saved the life of a child.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh. This is great. Every life is precious.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much for joining us.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And my final thoughts on a wild week, oh, my gosh, it's going get wilder next week, but wild week in Washington. Stay there.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Attorney General Bill Barr, he started this week with a bang, and I'll bet he does the same thing next week. We expect the redacted Mueller report to be dropped either Monday or Tuesday. You know where to come for the best legal analysis. For every detail that matters, right here on “The Ingraham Angle,” we have the best legal experts, Constitutional lawyers, people who have done this before, written these types of reports, so you want to keep it locked right here. And do not forget, get caught up on all my podcasts, you'll love it. Some people are coming up to me on the street, love the podcasts. Very easy. Go to PodcastOne or iTunes. You're going to have a blast. You'll laugh, learn all at the same time. America now and forever. And up next, Shannon Bream and the "Fox News @ Night" team, take it all from here. utterances.speaker: LAURA INGRAHAM, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hey, everybody. I'm Laura Ingraham this is “The Ingraham Angle” tonight from Washington. Now last night, we explained why Obama Intel czar Jim Clapper was so testy, gosh he was angry about Attorney General Bill Barr confirming that the Trump campaign had indeed been spied upon. Now he wasn't the only one. And tonight, is Jim Comey's turn in the barrel. Plus, the Democrats congressional hearings this week or a farce from beginning to end. All the embarrassing moments you know you miss them and the hilarious clap backs. All coming up. And Raymond Arroyo is here. So, what's behind Mayor Pete's religious war against Vice President Pence. Don't get it. And screwing Louis Farrakhan forgot what funeral he was attending. All that more in a special holy edition of Friday Follies. But first in our “Ingraham Angle,” we can review some stories you may have missed. Now, first we hit immigration. Now the left has a very interesting way of approaching this issue. It's not an emergency, is it? When 100,000 people are pouring across our southern border. But when it's reported that President Trump is considering busing illegal immigrant detainees to sanctuary cities. Well, the Democrats totally freak out. The President up the ante today.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: We can give him a lot. We can give them an unlimited supply and let's see if they're so happy. They say we have open arms. They're always say they have open arms. Let's see if they have open arms.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, now the President may have legal standing to make good on this threat and look at how the Democrats are squirming now. Nancy Pelosi said, the extent of this administration's cynicism and cruelty cannot be overstated. But wait a second, shouldn't she and her other California politicians, the ones are all for open borders. Shouldn't they be thrilled. They are the ones after all who have said this about sanctuary cities.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, SPEAKER, HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
utterances.utterance: In our sanctuary cities, our people are not disobeying the law. So, it's not a question of giving sanctuary someone who has - is guilty of a crime. UNIDENTIFIED MALE: The fact is sanctuary cities keep people safer. They keep people healthier and they keep people educated.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Gosh, I mean that's just a commercial for sanctuary cities. Take them in, bring them in, welcome them in. But it's not so simple, is it? Consider this horrific crime in the sanctuary city of Jersey City. An illegal alien is charged in the March 24th rape and murder of jogger Carolina Cano. Jorge Rios had been deported two times from the United States before returning illegally a third time. Now Cano worked as a nanny and friends say, she was an incredible woman of strong faith and a beautiful giving heart. But the left doesn't even acknowledge these American tragedies. They're too busy trying to demonize Trump on this and score political points, which brings us to our next story. This week, Democrats continued flailing in the wake of Bob Mueller's no collusion finding. Now I think they're beyond desperate at this point to regain political footing after two years of leveling defamatory and false accusations against the President. Remember he was basically spooning with Vladimir Putin before the election. But they've quickly found a new target, Attorney General Bill Barr.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: His credibility will be absolutely shredded if he fails to retract this assertion.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: He lost whatever credibility he may have had.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: The Chief Law Enforcement officer of our country is going off the rails.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The Attorney General feels that it's his job to do the President's bidding.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Now watching Barr at the hearings this week flick off all of their insipid comments and inquiries one-by-one. I've got to say I watch every minute of all these hearings and with Barr, it was better than anything on Netflix. The media though of course joined the Liberals bar crawl looking for any buzz they could get.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This guy is on a tight rope. On one side he wants to lean one way to make sure Trump keeps him in the job and the other way, don't look like an ass.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You can almost see in his mind, Barr going OK. How do I answer this question so, Trump doesn't tweet at me? So, I keep my job. But still not make a jackass of myself for life.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: That's tough.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: You know what's tough? This obvious thought. Afraid to lose his job. You mean go back to a comfortable no stress retirement and enjoy his grandkids. Are you kidding me? Why would Bill Barr do something unethical today in order to save a job he already had 30 years ago. News flash, he doesn't need to build his resume, kids. At the moment that sent shivers down the spines of the former Obama deep stators was this one.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I think spying on a political campaign is a big deal. Yes, I think spying did occur and I'm not suggesting it wasn't adequately predicated. But I need to explore that.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, I wondered how former FBI Chief Jim Comey felt upon hearing that spying reference.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Look this was terrible. It makes me mildly nauseous to think that we might have had some impact on the election.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, it turns out that former spooks was something to hide, practice the art of deflection and then they play word games.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Spying has a term I've never liked. I never liked that term being applied to me. It has a bad connotation. It's a pejorative term.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I really don't know what he's talking about when he talks about spying on the campaign. The FBI and the Department of Justice conduct court ordered electronic surveillance. I have never thought of that as spying.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So, let me get this straight. Clapper and Comey otherwise known as Jim Squared. That's what we call here, were the guys determined to get something on President Trump both through surveillance and leaking to the media. But now they're spending their time quibbling with the term spying. Now this concern which is all phony over semantics. Of course, it's reeks of desperation. I think the real fear is that Attorney General Barr is extremely serious. He's very judicious, extremely professional and he's on the case. utterances.utterance: What about those religious guides. I guess that is OK in the Episcopalian faith, I guess.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: This is the tension. This is the tension between religious liberty and other rights that are making a claim here.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: The question is should people be able to have their religious beliefs? Is he going to go through the list of Muslims, of orthodox Jews, of others who have a certain set of beliefs that might not be copasetic with what Ellen and he believes?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: When he announces on Palm Sunday. OK, we've got to talk about Pope Francis for a moment. Yesterday at the Vatican the 82-year-old Pope hosted a group of South Sudanese leaders who have been locked in a civil war since 2011. To drive home his plea for peace in a surprise move, the Pope got down on his hands and knees, Laura, to kiss the feet of four South Sudanese leaders. You can hear him heaving really heavily here. Remember, the Pope only has one functioning lung. Some have praised the humility of this gesture, it's power. Others have questioned it. They say it's an act of submission to political leaders and it could be interpreted by some, particularly Muslims on the ground in Sudan as an act of submission. I'm not sure I'm buying that interpretation. It is a rather dramatic gesture.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, it's supposed to be he's showing that he's, Christ came to be a servant.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: And humble.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Humility, he's in servitude to man.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I have got to say, does it become showy? He seemed to not like anyone kissing his ring, remember that?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: He did the ring kissing deal.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: Now he's kissing feet. But Laura, 400,000 dead in South Sudan, so it's a big challenge.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So maybe that will inspire people to get along, maybe. Yesterday in L.A. thousands lined the streets to say goodbye to rapper Nipsey Hussle. This dear artist recently released a song called "FDT," F Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: -- Donald Trump, yes -- Donald Trump. Yes, yes -- Donald Trump. -- Donald Trump. -- Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: That's a very creative refrain.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: Very catchy. Irving Berlin, look out.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: It all began and ended with Irving Berlin for you, didn't it?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So the refrain, the chorus that goes on and on, is that related to the lowest unemployment ever, basically, for African-Americans?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: But at Hussle's funeral, Laura, the less than holy religious figure Louis Farrakhan rose to offer a reflection.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: This is nice.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: It's always a good idea before you give a eulogy to know the name of the deceased. That helps. Which in this case was Nipsey Hussle.

utterances.speaker: LOUIS FARRAKHAN
utterances.utterance: The spiritual life of Nipsey Russell. I thank Nipsey Russell. I said it right.

utterances.speaker: FARRAKHAN
utterances.utterance: Russell.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: For those who might not remember, there was a '70s comedian, Nipsey Russell.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I love him.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Young people are very different today. And there's one sure way to know. Kids used to ask where they came from. Now they'll tell you where you can go.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Oh my God, was that "Match Game"?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: It was "Match Game."

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: My grandmother loved that.

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: Brett Somers come on down.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Wasn't he on "Hollywood Squares," and on "The Love Boat"?

utterances.speaker: ARROYO
utterances.utterance: I have to say, after that, I love Nipsey Russell. Nipsey Hussle, may he rest in peace.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: God bless. Up next, after passing a bill that essentially legalizes infanticide, what would you think the New York Assembly, you couldn't sink any lower if you were they. Now they're giving benefits to illegals that veterans' families are denied. I cannot believe this, you won't either, next.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Just how destructive can one state assembly be? In New York just over two months after celebrating their abortion expansion law, otherwise known as yay infanticide, New York Democrats just voted to block a provision that would extend additional college financial aid for Gold Star families. And if it wasn't disgusting enough, this vote came right after the same body approved millions in tuition assistance for, you got it, illegal aliens. Joining me is New York Republican State Senator Robert Ortt. Senator, what's your message to the country after what your colleagues on the left did? It's an insult to American veterans and American military families nationwide.

utterances.speaker: ROBERT ORTT, R-N.Y., STATE SENATOR
utterances.utterance: I think the message is New York should act as a warning to the rest of the country of what will happen if the Democrats take over all levels of power of the federal government in 2020, because they own everything here in New York, the Senate, the Assembly, and of course the governor's office. And this is what you get. You get priorities, I would say show me your budget, I'll show you your priorities -- $27 million, as you mentioned, for so the-called Dream Act to provide tuition assistance to illegal aliens, people who are here who have broken our immigration laws. And at the same time, they killed this bill which would have expanded access to the families, to the children of fallen servicemembers. If that isn't an inversion of what is right and good, I don't know what is. So it really is a message to I think the people who are watching out there that this is what the Democrats, the regressives will do if they get control of the U.S. government.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Both coasts were represented in this just obscene, radical thinking. California, if it moves tax it. Pushing the pot deal, the pot legal, all of the stuff in New York is basically becoming a mirror image. And this is what -- this is where we're going. It's open borders, rewarding lawlessness, and penalizing the hardworking people, families who don't make a lot of money, whose father or mother paid the ultimate price for our freedom. They don't care. I got to show something. This is from a New York congresswoman trying to defend all this, Deborah Glick. She's the chair of the committee that blocked the bill. She calls criticism of her basically a cheap shot. "The bill -- though laudable -- had a budgetary impact which the committee routinely doesn't consider post budget. We did promise to see funding in the future that considers potential additional eligible individuals. Cheap shot." Is it a cheap shot, they're going to take this under advisement later on? So why are you making a big deal?

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.utterance: This isn't a cheap shot at all. I think it's really rich that Congresswoman Glick and other Democrats, suddenly they're fiscal conservatives, suddenly they're concerned about the taxpayer and additional dollars spent. They just increased taxes by over $1 billion in the budget that was adopted April 1st. We were one of the highest tax states in the country. And they gave away $27 million tax dollars to folks who have broken our immigration laws and who are here in this state illegally. And yet when it comes to people who have given the ultimate sacrifices --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I don't know. It's too much money, costs too much.

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.utterance: -- and their families who bear the price, this is too much money. We need to hold the line and be fiscally conservative. That's really rich.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: The costs of freedom. Freedom costs something, doesn't it? This is what NBC 2 Buffalo pointed out, "providing free tuition for Gold Star children would not cost nearly as much as providing the same for tens of thousands of eligible Dreamers who will now be provided financial assistance to attend college by the state."

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So, it's a drop in the bucket compared to the cost would be for college assistance? Again, what's up is down, what's right is left. Everything has gone completely off the rails crazy if this is what New York stands for. I remember, I love New York, I used to wear one of those t- shirts. Not so much after infanticide and this. Close it out, senator.

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.utterance: No, you're 100 percent right, Laura. This really is a complete inversion, it's like Bizarro World, what is right is left, what is up is down. And basically you said it. If you are a hardworking, taxpaying New Yorker, if you served in the military, if you're in law enforcement, you are not a priority. If you're a criminal --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Why are you voting for this? New York, why are you voting for this? Why is this helping your state or doing anything to advance common sense principles of fiscal responsibility and fairness? Senator, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: ORTT
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Laura.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: And by the way, speaking of radicalism, a pro-choice college student, I like to say proabortion rights activist, says babies who survive abortion shouldn't get healthcare. But who does she actually say does deserve it? We'll tell you, next.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, you have been watching this show, you know that college campuses are worse than ever when it comes to free expression and real tolerance, especially the tolerance for views that are right to life. Well, take this exchange between a student at Boston College and Kristan Hawkins, president of students for life.

utterances.speaker: KRISTAN HAWKINS, STUDENTS FOR LIFE OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: Do you think that the children that are apprehended at the border that are in U.S. government care, do you think, like, babies who are going to die should be resuscitated and be given care?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.utterance: Do you believe that, like, a baby who's born alive during abortion at a Planned Parenthood should get care?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Joining me now is Kristan Hawkins. Kristan, you travel the country visiting college campuses, talking to students. You really kind of pointed out the -- illogical thinking is one thing. It's sad, it's funny in a way, but it's very sad. What happened next after that exchange?

utterances.speaker: KRISTAN HAWKINS, STUDENTS FOR LIFE OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: I actually asked her why she didn't believe that babies who are born alive during a failed abortion should be allowed to live. She said, well, we've already determined it's not a baby. And then she went on to say, I know you said science, but. And so what she pointed out was the cognitive dissonance we see all the time on college campuses across the country. And I don't know whether or not I changed her mind, but I know she certainly changed the minds of a lot of pro-choice students who actually came to the event to protest me. I got to see their eyes light up when she pointed out the leftist hypocrisy on this issue.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So again, for people who missed it, you asked about children at the border, should they be helped, should they be cared for, infants, yes. A baby who is born despite an attempt to abort the baby, no. But it's reflexive, is it not? It's not like there's some deep moment of reflection. It's reflexive.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.utterance: That's right. This is exactly, they're just repeating the talking points that they hear. And when it comes out of their mouth and you force the other side to actually say what it is they're advocating for, it changes the minds of everyone who is listening because they realize, this doesn't make sense. This is illogical. Your humanity shouldn't be determined by the location of your delivery room.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Isn't this what happened, you were at UCLA's campus about a year ago. Tell us about that.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I've been to UCLA, Berkeley, Harvard, Princeton, all of these schools, Dartmouth.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Good for you.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.utterance: And we have this conversation. My tour is called "The Lies that Feminists Tell." I just tell women, you are being lied to by the abortion lobby that tells you, you have to pay somebody else to commit an act of violence against somebody weaker than you in order for you to live your life as you see fit. And that's wrong. That's actually anti-feminist.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: And what is the reaction from, is there -- you're brave to be doing this. You're a brave person. I just want to salute you for doing this, because I think a lot of young women, I say this on the radio show, when you're in your 20s, especially when I was in my 20s, it wasn't an issue. But now, with the help of science, digital science techniques, you can see inside the womb, now it's a person. We were all -- speaking as a former embryo, we all were.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.utterance: That's right. And millennials, the good news is, Laura, the majority of our generation are actually pro-life. We're the largest voting bloc now in America, and we reject those lies that the abortion industry tells us.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Are you seeing "Unplanned"? Did you see "Unplanned"?

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.utterance: Absolutely, we sent thousands of students to see "Unplanned." We actually had a baby saved today in Indiana after students when and saw "Unplanned," went and prayed in front of Planned Parenthood and saved the life of a child.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh. This is great. Every life is precious.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Thank you so much for joining us.

utterances.speaker: HAWKINS
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: And my final thoughts on a wild week, oh, my gosh, it's going get wilder next week, but wild week in Washington. Stay there.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Attorney General Bill Barr, he started this week with a bang, and I'll bet he does the same thing next week. We expect the redacted Mueller report to be dropped either Monday or Tuesday. You know where to come for the best legal analysis. For every detail that matters, right here on “The Ingraham Angle,” we have the best legal experts, Constitutional lawyers, people who have done this before, written these types of reports, so you want to keep it locked right here. And do not forget, get caught up on all my podcasts, you'll love it. Some people are coming up to me on the street, love the podcasts. Very easy. Go to PodcastOne or iTunes.
